intro: Scandix pecten-veneris subsp. pecten-veneris, commonly known as the "sea holly," is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its striking, spiky, blue or purple flower heads that resemble the shell of the Venus shell, hence its common name. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and thrives in sandy or gravelly soils along the shore. It is often found in maritime climates and is adapted to salt spray and strong winds. Scandix pecten-veneris is an important plant in coastal ecosystems, providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
